thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger's brother lifts lid on 'problem' at Emirates | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger's brother lifts lid on 'problem' at Emirates | Metro News

author: Tom Olver For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger's brother lifts lid on 'problem' at Emirates | Metro News
text:
Tom Olver for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 11:22 am Will Arsene Wenger be manager of Arsenal next season? (Picture: Getty) 
Arsene Wenger ‘s brother has spoken out about the manager’s ‘problem’ at Arsenal in the aftermath of the side’s defeat to Bayern Munich. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
The Gunners boss has faced criticism for much of the campaign but the 5-1 thumping at the hands of the German champions led to increasingly speculation that he will step down in the summer. 
Wenger has stressed that he will definitely be managing next season, whether at Arsenal ‘or somewhere else’, and his brother feels sympathy over the growing unrest in north London. 
‘I feel sympathy for Arsene. The situation is not good for him,’ Guy Wenger told the Daily Mirror. Arsene Wenger’s men were thrashed at the Allianz Arena (Picture: Getty) 
‘But it is his problem, not mine. 
‘I was not in Munich for the match, I watched on television.
